oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Megarian Myths: Extrapolating the Narrative Traditions of Megara
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Solez, Kevin
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This chapter examines the local traditions (through Pausanias and Theognis), discourse environment, and positionality of Megara to establish abstract principles of the Megarian worldview, and then applies those principles to the local traditions in an attempt to present a cohesive account of Megarian myths from the earliest mythistorical times to the beginning of oligarchic government. An important discovery resulting from this is the general avoidance of all things Corinthian in Megarian narrative traditions.
